medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports waking up yesterday with acute diffuse abdominal pain, which was associated with nausea, forced emesis, and anorexia. The pain worsened and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) around 8 PM, described as sharp and constant. At around 1 AM, the patient felt a release of the intense pain and a sense of dissipation. The patient was febrile at home (102°F) and in the ED (100.7°F) and exhibited tachycardia initially at 137 bpm, improving to 103 bpm after a 2L bolus.
